totalBars.title: Total Bars
totalBars.description: The number of distinct categories or values represented in the bar chart.
totalBars.interpretation: More bars indicate higher data diversity, while fewer bars suggest data concentration.

highestValue.title: Highest Value
highestValue.description: The category with the maximum frequency or value in the dataset.
highestValue.interpretation: This represents the most common or dominant element in your data.

valueRange.title: Value Range
valueRange.description: The span between the minimum and maximum values in the dataset.
valueRange.interpretation: A wider range indicates more variability; a narrow range suggests data clustering.

distributionType.title: Distribution Type
distributionType.description: Statistical classification of how data values are spread across the range.
distributionType.interpretation: Normal: bell-curved, Moderate: slightly skewed, High Skew: heavily skewed to one side.

dominanceRatio.title: Dominance Ratio
dominanceRatio.description: The percentage of the dataset occupied by the most frequent value or category.
dominanceRatio.interpretation: High values (>50%) indicate strong concentration; low values suggest balanced distribution.

diversityIndex.title: Diversity Index
diversityIndex.description: A measure of how evenly distributed the values are across categories.
diversityIndex.interpretation: Higher values indicate more balanced distribution; lower values suggest dominance by few categories.

volatility.title: Volatility (CV)
volatility.description: Coefficient of Variation - measures relative variability as a percentage of the mean.
volatility.interpretation: Low (<30%): stable data, Medium (30-60%): moderate variation, High (>60%): highly variable.

totalRange.title: Total Range
totalRange.description: The absolute difference between the highest and lowest values.
totalRange.interpretation: Larger ranges indicate greater data spread; smaller ranges suggest data clustering.

rangeEfficiency.title: Range Efficiency
rangeEfficiency.description: The ratio of interquartile range to total range, measuring data concentration.
rangeEfficiency.interpretation: High values (>60%) indicate most data is concentrated; low values suggest outliers.

dataPoints.title: Data Points
dataPoints.description: The total number of observations or records in the dataset.
dataPoints.interpretation: More data points generally provide more reliable statistical insights.

trendDirection.title: Trend Direction
trendDirection.description: The overall directional movement of data values over time or sequence.
trendDirection.interpretation: Upward: increasing trend, Downward: decreasing trend, Stable: no clear direction.

averageValue.title: Average Value
averageValue.description: The arithmetic mean of all values in the dataset.
averageValue.interpretation: Represents the central tendency; useful for comparing with individual data points.

standardDeviation.title: Standard Deviation
standardDeviation.description: Measures the average distance of data points from the mean.
standardDeviation.interpretation: Lower values indicate data clustered around mean; higher values show more spread.

peakToTrough.title: Peak-to-Trough
peakToTrough.description: The percentage difference between maximum and minimum values relative to the mean.
peakToTrough.interpretation: Higher percentages indicate more extreme value variations in the dataset.

interquartileRange.title: Interquartile Range (IQR)
interquartileRange.description: The range containing the middle 50% of data values (Q3 - Q1).
interquartileRange.interpretation: Smaller IQR indicates tightly clustered data; larger IQR shows more spread.

dataDensity.title: Data Density
dataDensity.description: The number of data points available for scatter plot analysis.
dataDensity.interpretation: Higher density provides better visualization of patterns and relationships.

spreadAnalysis.title: Spread Analysis
spreadAnalysis.description: Classification of how widely scattered the data points are.
spreadAnalysis.interpretation: Low spread: clustered data, Medium: moderate scatter, High: widely distributed points.

outlierRatio.title: Outlier Ratio
outlierRatio.description: The percentage of data points that fall outside the expected range (1.5 × IQR).
outlierRatio.interpretation: Low (<5%): clean data, Moderate (5-15%): some outliers, High (>15%): many extreme values.

centralTendency.title: Central Tendency
centralTendency.description: Statistical measures indicating where the center of the data distribution lies.
centralTendency.interpretation: Mean and median close together suggests normal distribution; large differences indicate skewness.

dispersionIndex.title: Dispersion Index
dispersionIndex.description: The ratio of variance to mean, measuring how spread out the data is relative to its center.
dispersionIndex.interpretation: Values near 1 suggest Poisson-like distribution; much higher values indicate over-dispersion.

dataQuality.title: Data Quality
dataQuality.description: Assessment of data cleanliness based on outlier presence and distribution normality.
dataQuality.interpretation: Clean: minimal outliers, Good: acceptable outliers, Poor: many outliers present.

categoryCount.title: Category Count
categoryCount.description: The number of distinct segments or slices in the pie chart.
categoryCount.interpretation: Fewer categories are easier to interpret; too many (>7) can make visualization cluttered.

dominantShare.title: Dominant Share
dominantShare.description: The percentage and identity of the largest category in the pie chart.
dominantShare.interpretation: High dominance (>50%) indicates strong concentration; balanced shares suggest diversity.

minorityShare.title: Minority Share
minorityShare.description: The percentage and identity of the smallest category in the pie chart.
minorityShare.interpretation: Very small minorities (<5%) might be candidates for grouping with 'Other' category.

informationEntropy.title: Information Entropy
informationEntropy.description: Measures the amount of information or uncertainty in the categorical distribution.
informationEntropy.interpretation: Higher entropy indicates more balanced categories; lower entropy suggests concentration.

simpsonsIndex.title: Simpson's Index
simpsonsIndex.description: Measures the probability that two randomly selected items belong to the same category.
simpsonsIndex.interpretation: Higher values indicate greater diversity; lower values suggest dominance by few categories.

evennessScore.title: Evenness Score
evennessScore.description: Measures how evenly distributed the categories are relative to maximum possible evenness.
evennessScore.interpretation: Score near 1 indicates perfect evenness; lower scores suggest uneven distribution.

concentration.title: Concentration
concentration.description: Classification of how concentrated the data is among the largest categories.
concentration.interpretation: Distributed: balanced across categories, Moderate: some concentration, Concentrated: few dominant categories.

topDominance.title: Top 3 Dominance
topDominance.description: The combined percentage of the three largest categories.
topDominance.interpretation: High values (>80%) indicate concentration; low values (<60%) suggest balanced distribution.

fragmentation.title: Fragmentation
fragmentation.description: Assessment of how split up the data is across many small categories.
fragmentation.interpretation: High fragmentation may require category consolidation for clearer insights.

totalArea.title: Total Area Under Curve
totalArea.description: The cumulative sum of all values, representing total magnitude or volume.
totalArea.interpretation: Larger areas indicate higher overall values or greater cumulative effect.

averageHeight.title: Average Height
averageHeight.description: The mean value across all data points in the area chart.
averageHeight.interpretation: Represents typical magnitude; useful for establishing baseline expectations.

areaEfficiency.title: Area Efficiency
areaEfficiency.description: The ratio of average height to maximum height, showing utilization of potential.
areaEfficiency.interpretation: High efficiency (>70%) indicates consistent values; low efficiency suggests peaks and valleys.

growthPattern.title: Growth Pattern
growthPattern.description: The overall shape and direction of change in the area chart over time or sequence.
growthPattern.interpretation: Accelerating: increasing growth rate, Decelerating: decreasing rate, Linear: steady change.

volatilityIndex.title: Volatility Index
volatilityIndex.description: Coefficient of variation measuring relative instability in the data series.
volatilityIndex.interpretation: Low volatility (<0.3): stable, Medium (0.3-0.6): moderately variable, High (>0.6): unstable.

smoothness.title: Smoothness
smoothness.description: Assessment of how consistent and steady the data progression is.
smoothness.interpretation: Smooth data has predictable patterns; volatile data has irregular fluctuations.

maximumValue.title: Maximum Value
maximumValue.description: The highest single value observed in the dataset.
maximumValue.interpretation: Represents peak performance or maximum capacity reached in the measured phenomenon.

peakToAverage.title: Peak-to-Average Ratio
peakToAverage.description: How many times larger the maximum value is compared to the average.
peakToAverage.interpretation: High ratios indicate significant peaks; ratios near 1 suggest consistent values.

q1Percentile.title: Q1 (25th Percentile)
q1Percentile.description: The value below which 25% of the data points fall.
q1Percentile.interpretation: Represents the lower quartile boundary; useful for identifying bottom performers.

medianValue.title: Q2 (Median)
medianValue.description: The middle value when all data points are arranged in order.
medianValue.interpretation: Less affected by outliers than mean; represents typical value in the dataset.

q3Percentile.title: Q3 (75th Percentile)
q3Percentile.description: The value below which 75% of the data points fall.
q3Percentile.interpretation: Represents upper quartile boundary; useful for identifying top performers.

outlierCount.title: Outlier Count
outlierCount.description: Number and percentage of data points falling outside 1.5 × IQR from quartiles.
outlierCount.interpretation: Few outliers indicate clean data; many outliers may suggest data quality issues or extreme events.

fenceBoundaries.title: Fence Boundaries
fenceBoundaries.description: The calculated limits beyond which data points are considered statistical outliers.
fenceBoundaries.interpretation: Values outside these boundaries warrant investigation as potential anomalies or special cases.

symmetry.title: Symmetry
symmetry.description: Measures whether the data distribution is balanced around the median.
symmetry.interpretation: Symmetric: balanced distribution, Right-skewed: tail extends right, Left-skewed: tail extends left.

tailBehavior.title: Tail Behavior
tailBehavior.description: Describes the thickness of the distribution tails (extremes) relative to normal distribution.
tailBehavior.interpretation: Heavy tails: more extreme values than expected, Light tails: fewer extreme values.

spreadRatio.title: Spread Ratio
spreadRatio.description: The percentage of total range occupied by the middle 50% of data (IQR/Range).
spreadRatio.interpretation: High ratios indicate concentrated data; low ratios suggest outliers extend the range.

heatZones.title: Heat Zones
heatZones.description: The number of distinct intensity levels or value ranges in the heatmap.
heatZones.interpretation: More zones provide finer granularity; fewer zones show clearer patterns but less detail.

intensityRange.title: Intensity Range
intensityRange.description: The span from lowest to highest intensity values in the heatmap.
intensityRange.interpretation: Wide ranges indicate diverse intensity levels; narrow ranges suggest similar intensities.

hotSpotRatio.title: Hot Spot Ratio
hotSpotRatio.description: The percentage of the heatmap dominated by the highest intensity values.
hotSpotRatio.interpretation: High ratios indicate concentrated hot spots; low ratios suggest distributed intensity.

clustering.title: Clustering
clustering.description: Assessment of whether high or low intensities group together or are scattered.
clustering.interpretation: Clustered: similar values group together, Dispersed: values scattered randomly.

entropyLevel.title: Entropy Level
entropyLevel.description: Measures the randomness or unpredictability in the intensity distribution.
entropyLevel.interpretation: High entropy indicates complex patterns; low entropy suggests simple, predictable patterns.

uniformityScore.title: Uniformity Score
uniformityScore.description: Measures how evenly the different intensity levels are distributed.
uniformityScore.interpretation: High scores indicate balanced intensity distribution; low scores suggest concentration.

averageTemperature.title: Average Temperature
averageTemperature.description: The mean intensity value across all cells in the heatmap.
averageTemperature.interpretation: Represents baseline intensity level; useful for comparing individual cells.

heatVariance.title: Heat Variance
heatVariance.description: Measures how much the intensity values vary from the average intensity.
heatVariance.interpretation: High variance indicates dramatic intensity differences; low variance suggests consistent intensity.

coldSpots.title: Cold Spots
coldSpots.description: The number of cells with intensity values below the average level.
coldSpots.interpretation: Many cold spots indicate diverse intensity; few cold spots suggest generally high intensity.

leftChartType.title: Left Chart Type
leftChartType.description: The visualization method used for the left panel in dual chart mode.
leftChartType.interpretation: Different chart types reveal different aspects of the same data for comprehensive analysis.

rightChartType.title: Right Chart Type
rightChartType.description: The visualization method used for the right panel in dual chart mode.
rightChartType.interpretation: Complementary chart types provide multiple perspectives on data patterns and relationships.

scaleSync.title: Scale Sync
scaleSync.description: Whether both charts use the same value scale for direct comparison.
scaleSync.interpretation: Enabled: allows direct value comparison, Disabled: each chart optimizes its own scale.

sharedDataPoints.title: Shared Data Points
sharedDataPoints.description: The number of data observations being analyzed across both chart views.
sharedDataPoints.interpretation: Same data shown through different visualizations to reveal complementary insights.

visualizationFocus.title: Visualization Focus
visualizationFocus.description: The analytical approach enabled by viewing data through multiple chart types simultaneously.
visualizationFocus.interpretation: Multi-perspective analysis reveals patterns that single charts might miss.

insightDepth.title: Insight Depth
insightDepth.description: The level of analytical understanding achieved through dual visualization.
insightDepth.interpretation: Enhanced depth comes from seeing same data through complementary analytical lenses.

meanValue.title: Mean Value
meanValue.description: The arithmetic average of all data points in the shared dataset.
meanValue.interpretation: Central reference point that applies to both visualizations for consistent interpretation.

coefficientVariation.title: Coefficient of Variation
coefficientVariation.description: Standardized measure of variability expressed as percentage of the mean.
coefficientVariation.interpretation: Consistent variability measure that applies to both chart perspectives equally.

trueCount.title: True Count
trueCount.description: The number of records with True/Yes/1 values in the boolean column.
trueCount.interpretation: Higher counts indicate more positive cases in your dataset.

falseCount.title: False Count
falseCount.description: The number of records with False/No/0 values in the boolean column.
falseCount.interpretation: Higher counts indicate more negative cases in your dataset.

truePercentage.title: True Percentage
truePercentage.description: The percentage of records with True values out of total non-null values.
truePercentage.interpretation: Values near 50% indicate balanced data; extreme values suggest data skew.

falsePercentage.title: False Percentage
falsePercentage.description: The percentage of records with False values out of total non-null values.
falsePercentage.interpretation: Values near 50% indicate balanced data; extreme values suggest data skew.

balanceRatio.title: Balance Ratio
balanceRatio.description: The ratio between True and False counts, indicating data balance.
balanceRatio.interpretation: Values near 1.0 indicate balanced data; higher values suggest True dominance.

constantValue.title: Constant Value
constantValue.description: The single value that appears in all records of this column.
constantValue.interpretation: All data points have the same value - consider if this column adds analytical value.

recordCount.title: Record Count
recordCount.description: Total number of records containing the constant value.
recordCount.interpretation: Shows data completeness - all records should contain the same value.

uniqueIdCount.title: Unique ID Count
uniqueIdCount.description: Total number of unique identifiers in the dataset.
uniqueIdCount.interpretation: Should match total record count for proper unique identification.

duplicateCount.title: Duplicate Count
duplicateCount.description: Number of duplicate ID values found in the dataset.
duplicateCount.interpretation: Zero indicates proper unique identification; higher values suggest data quality issues.

idPattern.title: ID Pattern
idPattern.description: The detected pattern or format of the unique identifiers.
idPattern.interpretation: Consistent patterns indicate systematic ID generation; mixed patterns may need investigation.

averageIdLength.title: Average ID Length
averageIdLength.description: The average character length of the unique identifiers.
averageIdLength.interpretation: Consistent lengths suggest standardized ID format; high variation may indicate mixed systems.

dateRange.title: Date Range
dateRange.description: The time span from the earliest to the latest date in the dataset.
dateRange.interpretation: Shows temporal coverage - longer ranges indicate more historical data depth.

earliestDate.title: Earliest Date
earliestDate.description: The oldest date value found in the dataset.
earliestDate.interpretation: Represents the starting point of your time series data.

latestDate.title: Latest Date
latestDate.description: The most recent date value found in the dataset.
latestDate.interpretation: Represents the end point of your time series data.

dateFormat.title: Date Format
dateFormat.description: The detected format pattern of the date values.
dateFormat.interpretation: Consistent formats ensure proper date parsing and analysis.

temporalDistribution.title: Temporal Distribution
temporalDistribution.description: How date values are distributed across the time range.
temporalDistribution.interpretation: Even distribution suggests consistent data collection; clusters may indicate specific periods.

yearSpread.title: Year Spread
yearSpread.description: The number of different years represented in the date data.
yearSpread.interpretation: More years indicate longer historical coverage; single year suggests recent or limited data.

nullCount.title: Null Values
nullCount.description: The number of records with missing, empty, or null values.
nullCount.interpretation: High null counts may indicate data quality issues or incomplete data collection.

mostCommonValue.title: Most Common Value
mostCommonValue.description: The value that appears most frequently in the dataset.
mostCommonValue.interpretation: Indicates the dominant category or most typical value in your data.

minFrequency.title: Minimum Frequency
minFrequency.description: The lowest count of occurrences for any category in the dataset.
minFrequency.interpretation: Shows the least represented category - may indicate rare cases or outliers.

averageFrequency.title: Average Frequency
averageFrequency.description: The mean number of occurrences across all categories.
averageFrequency.interpretation: Provides baseline expectation for category distribution balance.

diversity.title: Diversity Level
diversity.description: A measure of how evenly distributed values are across categories.
diversity.interpretation: High diversity suggests balanced data; low diversity indicates concentration.

recordsPerDay.title: Records Per Day
recordsPerDay.description: Average number of records captured per day within the date range.
recordsPerDay.interpretation: Higher values suggest frequent data collection; lower values indicate sparse temporal data.

avgTimeGap.title: Average Time Gap
avgTimeGap.description: The average time interval between consecutive date records.
avgTimeGap.interpretation: Consistent gaps suggest regular data collection; irregular gaps may indicate missing periods.

timelineDistribution.title: Timeline Distribution
timelineDistribution.description: How date values are spread across different time periods.
timelineDistribution.interpretation: Even distribution indicates consistent data collection over time.

uniqueness.title: Uniqueness Percentage
uniqueness.description: The percentage of values that are unique identifiers.
uniqueness.interpretation: 100% uniqueness is ideal for ID columns; lower values indicate duplicate identifiers.

patternConsistency.title: Pattern Consistency
patternConsistency.description: How consistently the ID values follow a detected pattern format.
patternConsistency.interpretation: High consistency suggests systematic ID generation; inconsistency may indicate mixed sources.

completeness.title: Data Completeness
completeness.description: The percentage of non-null values in the dataset.
completeness.interpretation: High completeness indicates good data quality; low values suggest missing data issues.

qualityScore.title: Data Quality Score
qualityScore.description: Overall assessment of data quality based on multiple factors.
qualityScore.interpretation: Higher scores indicate better data quality and reliability for analysis.

skewnessValue.title: Skewness
skewnessValue.description: Measure of asymmetry in the data distribution.
skewnessValue.interpretation: Values near 0 indicate symmetric distribution; positive values show right skew; negative values show left skew.

outlierCount.title: Outliers
outlierCount.description: Data points that fall significantly outside the normal range of values.
outlierCount.interpretation: High outlier counts may indicate data quality issues or extreme cases requiring investigation.

dataBalance.title: Data Balance
dataBalance.description: Assessment of how evenly distributed True and False values are in the dataset.
dataBalance.interpretation: Well-balanced data has roughly equal True/False counts; imbalanced data may affect analysis results.

leastCommonValue.title: Least Common Value
leastCommonValue.description: The value that appears least frequently in the dataset.
leastCommonValue.interpretation: Shows the minority category - may represent rare cases or underrepresented groups.

duplicateDates.title: Duplicate Dates
duplicateDates.description: Whether the dataset contains repeated date values.
duplicateDates.interpretation: Duplicates may indicate multiple events on the same date or data quality issues.

timezone.title: Timezone
timezone.description: The detected timezone information in the date data.
timezone.interpretation: Consistent timezone data ensures accurate temporal analysis across different regions.

invalidDates.title: Invalid Dates
invalidDates.description: The number of records that could not be parsed as valid dates.
invalidDates.interpretation: High invalid counts indicate data quality issues requiring cleanup or format standardization.

minimumValue.title: Minimum Value
minimumValue.description: The smallest value found in the dataset.
minimumValue.interpretation: Represents the lower bound of your data range - useful for understanding data boundaries.

uniqueValues.title: Unique Values
uniqueValues.description: The number of distinct values in the dataset.
uniqueValues.interpretation: Higher counts indicate more diversity; lower counts suggest repeated values or categories.

uniqueRatio.title: Unique Ratio
uniqueRatio.description: The percentage of values that are unique out of total values.
uniqueRatio.interpretation: 100% means all values are unique; lower percentages indicate duplicate values.

categoricalDiversity.title: Categorical Diversity
categoricalDiversity.description: A measure of how varied the categories are in the dataset.
categoricalDiversity.interpretation: High diversity suggests balanced categories; low diversity indicates dominant categories.

maxFrequency.title: Maximum Frequency
maxFrequency.description: The highest count of any single category in the dataset.
maxFrequency.interpretation: Shows the popularity of the most common category - indicates concentration level.

totalWords.title: Total Words
totalWords.description: The combined count of all words across all text entries.
totalWords.interpretation: Higher word counts suggest more detailed or comprehensive text content.

vocabularyRichness.title: Vocabulary Richness
vocabularyRichness.description: The ratio of unique words to total words, indicating vocabulary diversity.
vocabularyRichness.interpretation: Higher values suggest more diverse language use; lower values indicate repetitive text.

entropy.title: Entropy
entropy.description: Shannon entropy measuring information content and predictability in boolean data.
entropy.interpretation: Higher entropy (near 1 bit) indicates balanced True/False distribution; lower entropy suggests predictable outcomes.

informationContent.title: Information Content
informationContent.description: Classification of entropy level indicating data predictability.
informationContent.interpretation: Maximum: highly unpredictable, High: good uncertainty, Medium: moderate predictability, Low: very predictable.

biasMagnitude.title: Bias Magnitude
biasMagnitude.description: The percentage deviation from perfect 50-50 balance in boolean data.
biasMagnitude.interpretation: 0% indicates perfect balance; higher percentages show increasing bias toward one value.

predictability.title: Predictability
predictability.description: Classification of how predictable the boolean outcomes are based on distribution.
predictability.interpretation: Random: unpredictable (near 50-50), Moderately Predictable: slight bias (60-70%), Highly Predictable: strong bias (>70%).

purity.title: Purity
purity.description: Percentage of values that are valid boolean values (excluding nulls/other).
purity.interpretation: 100% indicates clean boolean data; lower percentages suggest data quality issues or mixed types.

consistency.title: Consistency
consistency.description: Assessment of how consistent the boolean data format is.
consistency.interpretation: High: clean boolean values only, Medium: some variants, Low: mixed or inconsistent formats.

dataType.title: Data Type Classification
dataType.description: Classification of the boolean column based on value patterns.
dataType.interpretation: Pure Boolean: standard true/false, Boolean Variants: mixed formats, Mixed: includes non-boolean values.

totalCategories.title: Total Categories
totalCategories.description: The total number of distinct categories in the categorical column.
totalCategories.interpretation: Higher counts indicate more diversity; lower counts suggest concentrated data.

giniIndex.title: Gini Index
giniIndex.description: Gini coefficient measuring inequality in category distribution (0-1 scale).
giniIndex.interpretation: 0 indicates perfect equality, 1 indicates maximum inequality; higher values show concentration.

shannonEntropy.title: Shannon Entropy
shannonEntropy.description: Information entropy measuring uncertainty in categorical distribution (in bits).
shannonEntropy.interpretation: Higher values indicate more balanced categories; lower values suggest dominant categories.

simpsonIndex.title: Simpson's Diversity Index
simpsonIndex.description: Probability-based diversity measure (0-1 scale) for categorical data.
simpsonIndex.interpretation: Values near 1 indicate high diversity; values near 0 suggest dominance by few categories.

evenness.title: Evenness
evenness.description: Measure of how evenly distributed categories are relative to maximum possible evenness.
evenness.interpretation: 100% indicates perfect evenness; lower percentages show uneven distribution.

dominance.title: Dominance
dominance.description: The percentage of data occupied by the most frequent category.
dominance.interpretation: High values (>50%) indicate strong concentration; low values suggest balanced distribution.

singletons.title: Singletons
singletons.description: The number of categories that appear exactly once in the dataset.
singletons.interpretation: Many singletons may indicate high diversity or potential data quality issues.

topCategoriesShare.title: Top Categories Share
topCategoriesShare.description: Combined percentage of the top 3 most frequent categories.
topCategoriesShare.interpretation: High values (>80%) indicate concentration; low values (<60%) suggest balanced distribution.

diversityLevel.title: Diversity Level
diversityLevel.description: Classification of categorical diversity based on unique ratio.
diversityLevel.interpretation: Very High: >80% unique, High: 60-80%, Medium: 30-60%, Low: <30%.
